page.title: 04Salt Lane :Banbury
page.content:
Years ago Salt Lane was used to carry salt from {Droitwich to Banbury}. People knew they carried salt along it, and that is how it became known as {Salt Lane}. Today when we go along it there is only a mud track. When we went along it, it was very muddy and I lost my boots. Salt Lane is used for horse riding when its dry and for walking along. It is also used by cyclists as a short-cut to Broughton Castle and Giant's Cave. The bushes are growing a lot because they are not cut.
Salt Lane is {6 kilometres long} and about 5 metres wide.
